page.title: 12Employment and Unemployment
page.content: The men of this area are mainly employmed as tradesmen such as builders,joiners, electricians or painters. There are a few steelworkers, motor mechanics and railway linesmen. We also have signwriters, technicians, a printer and a pharmacist. There are very few agricultural workers considering that this is a largely rural area. This is due to farm mechanisation. There is a considerable number of men unemployed and there are about ten per cent of the children living in one_parent families. some of the women work in local hospitals, shops or hotel. Young people leaving school have the usual problem of trying to find work. There are a number of OAP's in the area who are treated to an annual holiday in the North of England paid for by a lottery held in the village.
